title.narrative: ADVOCACY AND PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: Partners and key stakeholders in Thailand have increased knowledge, capacity and opportunities to effectively advocate for the protection and realization of child rights., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Evaluation, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country Programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Partners and key stakeholders in Thailand have increased knowledge, capacity and opportunities to effectively advocate for theprotection and realization of child rights.

description.narrative: Increased knowledge and awareness through nation-wide public advocacy campaigns on sensitive topics:youth mental health (18 million reach) and ending childhood statelessness (12 million reach/7 million engagement) with positive post-campaign assessment of impact on audience awareness and perception. Non-financial supporter engagement strengthened with18,681 supporters registered in “I Am UNICEF,” 11 new partnerships, 3 new ”Friends of UNICEF,” and engagement withover 80 celebrities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
